workflow.name: Generate AI images with text prompts using BananaAPI and Nano Banana Engine
workflow.description:
# Cheap Nano Banana API - AI Image Generator with BananaAPI.com

## Overview
This workflow integrates **BananaAPI.com** with the **Nano Banana** image engine to generate or edit AI images from **text prompts** and optional **reference images**.  

Users simply fill out a form with their prompt and preferences, the workflow submits the request to BananaAPI, polls the status until it is complete, and then returns the final image link.  

**Why use it?**
- Super affordable: only **$0.025 per image**
- **Pay-as-you-go** pricing ‚Äî no monthly subscription
- **Credits never expire** ‚Äî use anytime, no pressure  
Perfect for creators, marketers, and developers looking for a cost-effective AI image generator inside n8n.

---

## Prerequisites
- A **BananaAPI.com account + API key** (Bearer token). Sign up at [BananaAPI.com](https://bananaapi.com/api).  
- An **n8n instance** (Cloud or self-hosted).  
- Basic knowledge of crafting **AI prompts** for better quality results.  

‚ö†Ô∏è Important: Never expose your API key in public workflows. Use **n8n Credentials** for production setups.

---

## Setup Instructions

### 1. Obtain API Key
- Create an account at BananaAPI.com, generate your API key, and keep it safe.

### 2. Configure the Form
The **Form Trigger** collects the following fields:
- `api_token` (required) ‚Äî Banana API key  
- `prompt` (required) ‚Äî image description (e.g., *‚Äúa neon cyberpunk cat, detailed, 4k‚Äù*)  
- `Output Format [optional]` ‚Äî choose PNG or JPEG  
- `Image Size [optional]` ‚Äî 16:9, 9:16, 1:1, 3:4, 4:3  
- `image_url_1 ... image_url_5 [optional]` ‚Äî reference images for editing/transform  

### 3. Workflow Execution
1. User fills the form and submits.  
2. Workflow sends a **POST** request to `https://bananaapi.com/api/n8n/generate/`.  
3. BananaAPI forwards the job to **Nano Banana**.  
4. Workflow waits 5s, then polls status via `image-status/{taskId}`.  
5. If `status != completed`, loop until ready.  
6. Once completed, workflow returns the final image URL.  

### 4. Outputs
The workflow returns:  
- `image_url` ‚Äî the generated image link  
- `task_id` ‚Äî task reference ID  
- `status` ‚Äî job status (completed/pending)  

üí° Tip: Add a **Webhook Response** node to return clean JSON for frontend apps.

---

## Customization Tips
- **Enhance prompts** with details like style (photorealistic, cartoon, cyberpunk), lighting, or action for better results.  
- Use `image_url_1` with a strong prompt to create **image editing** flows.  
- Adjust **wait time** (5s ‚Üí 8‚Äì10s) to optimize polling frequency.  
- Add validation to ensure required fields are always filled in.  

---

## API Reference
- **POST** `https://bananaapi.com/api/n8n/generate/`  
- **GET** `https://bananaapi.com/api/n8n/image-status/{taskId}`  
Docs: [BananaAPI Docs](https://bananaapi.com/api)

‚úÖ Always include `Authorization: Bearer <token>` in headers.

---

## Pricing Advantages
- **$0.025 per image** ‚Äî cheaper than most alternatives  
- **Pay-as-you-go** ‚Äî no monthly subscription required  
- **Credits never expire** ‚Äî full flexibility to use anytime  

This makes BananaAPI + Nano Banana one of the most **budget-friendly** AI image solutions for automation workflows.

---

## Troubleshooting
- **401/403 Unauthorized** ‚Üí Check Authorization header (`Bearer token`).  
- **Invalid JSON** ‚Üí Ensure POST body is valid JSON (double quotes, no trailing commas).  
- **No imageUrl returned** ‚Üí Task still pending; wait longer or verify taskId.  
- **Slow performance** ‚Üí Increase wait interval (8‚Äì10s).  

---

## Security Best Practices
- Do not hardcode API tokens in public workflows.  
- Use **n8n Credentials** for storing tokens securely.  
- Hide sensitive fields in forms or use Webhooks for controlled access.

parameters.formDescription: Enter the prompt and (optionally) the original image link for the Banana API to generate a new image.

parameters.content:
## Overview
This workflow integrates **BananaAPI.com** with the **Google Nano Banana** image generation engine. Users can submit prompts and optional reference images via a form, then the workflow calls BananaAPI.com, checks the task status in a loop, and finally returns the generated image link.

**Why use it?**
- Cost effective: only **$0.025 per image**
- **Pay-as-you-go**: pay only for what you use
- **Credits never expire**: no monthly subscription pressure

Ideal for creators, marketers, and developers who want affordable and automated image generation.

## Prerequisites
- **BananaAPI.com account + API key (Bearer)** ‚Äî create your key at https://bananaapi.com/api
- An **n8n instance** (Cloud or self-hosted)
- Basic knowledge of AI prompts to get the best quality images

‚ö†Ô∏è Never commit or share your API key publicly. Use **n8n Credentials** for production setups.

## Step 1 ‚Äî User Form Input
The **Form Trigger** asks the user to provide:
- `api_token` (required) ‚Äî Banana API Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE
- `prompt` (required) ‚Äî image description (e.g. *‚Äúa neon cyberpunk cat, detailed, 4k‚Äù*)
- `Output Format [optional]` ‚Äî choose PNG or JPEG
- `Image Size [optional]` ‚Äî 16:9, 9:16, 1:1, 3:4, 4:3
- `image_url_1 ... image_url_5 [optional]` ‚Äî reference images for editing or transformation

## Step 2 ‚Äî Submit to Banana API
The **HTTP POST** node sends the request:
- URL: `https://bananaapi.com/api/n8n/generate/`
- Headers:
  - `Content-Type: application/json`
  - `Authorization: Bearer {{ $json.api_token }}`
- JSON Body includes:
  - `prompt`
  - `image_size`
  - `output_format`
  - `image_urls` (array of up to 5)

BananaAPI will return a `taskId` to track progress.

## Step 3 ‚Äî Processing
BananaAPI forwards the request to the **Nano Banana** engine, which generates or edits the image based on the prompt and optional input images.

‚è± Average generation time: a few seconds to ~1 minute, depending on complexity and server load.
- After 5s wait, the workflow calls:
  `GET https://bananaapi.com/api/n8n/image-status/{{ taskId }}`
- If `status != completed`, the loop waits 5s and retries
- When `status = completed`, the workflow continues

## Step 4 ‚Äî Return Output
When completed, the **Set node** outputs:
- `image_url` ‚Äî the final generated image link
- `task_id` ‚Äî the task reference ID
- `status` ‚Äî task completion state

üí° Tip: Add a **Webhook Response** node to return a clean JSON payload for frontend apps.

## API Reference
- **POST** `https://bananaapi.com/api/n8n/generate/`
- **GET** `https://bananaapi.com/api/n8n/image-status/{taskId}`

Docs: https://bananaapi.com/api

‚úÖ Always include `Authorization: Bearer <token>` in headers.

## Pricing Advantages
- **Only $0.025 per image** ‚Äî very cost-effective
- **Pay-as-you-go**: no monthly subscription
- **Credits never expire** ‚Äî use anytime, no rush

Perfect for scaling automation workflows or experimenting without wasted costs.

## Troubleshooting
- **401/403 Unauthorized** ‚Üí Check Authorization header (`Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE`)
- **Invalid JSON** ‚Üí Ensure POST body is valid JSON (double quotes, no trailing commas)
- **No imageUrl returned** ‚Üí Task still pending; wait longer or re-check taskId
- **Slow performance** ‚Üí Increase wait interval from 5s to 8‚Äì10s

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
